caption:
This photograph depicts two elderly women engaged in playing cards, possibly in a home setting. The woman on the left, partially visible from the side, is wearing glasses and a bright red top. She has short, white hair, and appears to be looking at her hand of cards which is spread out, though not visible directly to the viewer.

The second woman, slightly more in focus and situated on the right, is dressed in a green cardigan over a white blouse. She is meticulously examining her own set of cards. Her hair is also white and she has a calm, concentrated demeanor. Both women are seated, though only their upper bodies and heads are visible.

The room in which they are situated appears cozy and softly lit, with a lamp visible in the background casting a warm glow. The atmosphere suggests an intimate, relaxed setting typical of a private residence, possibly a living room, decorated with modest, traditional furnishings including a fabric upholstered chair and a decorative, dark-toned table lamp. The overall mood of the image is one of quiet camaraderie and leisurely enjoyment.
title: A librarian, left, and a teacher, both employees of senior high school in New Ulm, Minnesota.  Are seen playing bridge in the evening.  The town is a county seat trading center of 13,000 in a farming area of south central Minnesota.  It was founded in 1854 by a german immigrant land company that encouraged its kinsmen to emigrate from europe.  Several manufacturing firms have located there since 1950 and have helped the town to grow
